channel.title: NDTV News Search Records Found 1000
channel.description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

item.title: "She's Wrong": Trump On Spy Chief Tulsi Gabbard's Iran Nuclear Remark

media:content.media:description: Tulsi Gabbard testified to Congress that US believes that Iran was not building a nuclear weapon.

item.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that his Director of National Intelligence, Tulsi Gabbard, was wrong in suggesting there was no evidence Iran is building a nuclear weapon.
item.content:encoded: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that his Director of National Intelligence, Tulsi Gabbard, was wrong in suggesting there was no evidence Iran is building a nuclear weapon.

item.title: Trump Says He May Support Israel-Iran Ceasefire "Depending On Circumstances"

media:content.media:description: Europe would not be able to help much in the war between Iran and Israel, Trump added.

item.description: President Donald Trump said on Friday he might support a ceasefire in the week-old aerial conflict between U.S. ally Israel and its regional rival Iran "depending on the circumstances".
item.content:encoded: President Donald Trump said on Friday he might support a ceasefire in the week-old aerial conflict between U.S. ally Israel and its regional rival Iran "depending on the circumstances".

item.title: Over 650 Iranian Military Personnel, Civilians Killed In Israeli Strikes

media:content.media:description: At least 263 civilians killed in Israeli strikes in Iran, the report said.

item.description: A US-based NGO said Friday that Israel's strikes against Iran have killed at least 657 people including civilians and members of the security forces, a toll based on sources and reports in Iran.
item.content:encoded: A US-based NGO said Friday that Israel's strikes against Iran have killed at least 657 people including civilians and members of the security forces, a toll based on sources and reports in Iran.

item.title: Russia Advancing Long-Term Economic Ties With India, Key Partners: Putin

media:content.media:description: "A new world order is emerging naturally, like the rising sun", Putin said.

item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday said Moscow's action plan for long-term cooperation till 2030 with India should be finalised shortly.
item.content:encoded: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday said Moscow's action plan for long-term cooperation till 2030 with India should be finalised shortly.

item.title: Israel-Iran Conflict: How 'Cluster Bomb' Works, Why It's Controversial

media:content.media:description: Israeli security forces walk near Soroka Medical Centre in Beersheba

item.description: Israel has alleged that Iran fired a missile with cluster bomb warhead on a civilian area. The missile started releasing the bomblets at an altitude of 23,000 feet (7 km). The Iranian missile scattered at least 20 bomblets across a radius of 8 km.
item.content:encoded: <iframe title="Player" class="head-story__img img__full lazyload" height="300" scrolling=no frameborder=no src="about:blank" data-src="https://www.ndtv.com/video/embed-player/id/955193/play-via-app-wap?pWidth=100&pHeight=100&embed_type=story&site=classic&autostart=1"> </iframe>Israel has alleged that Iran fired a missile with cluster bomb warhead on a civilian area. The missile started releasing the bomblets at an altitude of 23,000 feet (7 km). The Iranian missile scattered at least 20 bomblets across a radius of 8 km.

item.title: France's Macron Says Europe To Push Peace Plan To End Iran-Israel Conflict

media:content.media:description: European powers are preparing to present Iran with a peace proposal

item.description: The proposal marks one of the most expansive peace efforts by Europe in recent years, addressing not just Iran's nuclear ambitions but also the broader spectrum of regional instability linked to Tehran.
item.content:encoded: The proposal marks one of the most expansive peace efforts by Europe in recent years, addressing not just Iran's nuclear ambitions but also the broader spectrum of regional instability linked to Tehran.

item.title: 40-Year-Old UK Man Dies After Stomach Ache Turned Out To Be Colon Cancer

media:content.media:description: The 40-year-old was diagnosed with stage four colon cancer. (Representative pic)

item.description: A 40-year-old man in the United Kingdom died from colon cancer months after experiencing stomach pain, which he initially believed was due to stress.
item.content:encoded: A 40-year-old man in the United Kingdom died from colon cancer months after experiencing stomach pain, which he initially believed was due to stress.

item.title: Can A Foreign Government Hack WhatsApp? A Cybersecurity Expert Explains How That Might Work

media:content.media:description: Israeli firms have repeatedly been linked to hacking WhatsApp accounts.

item.description: Iranian officials on wednesday, urged the countrys citizens to remove the messaging platform WhatsApp from their smartphones.
item.content:encoded: Iranian officials on wednesday, urged the countrys citizens to remove the messaging platform WhatsApp from their smartphones.

item.title: "Asked India For Ceasefire When...": Pak Deputy PM's Viral Admission On Op Sindoor

media:content.media:description: Pak Deputy Prime Minister Ishaq Dar

item.description: Pakistan's Deputy Prime Minister Ishaq Dar has said the country was compelled to request a ceasefire with India last month after the latter struck two of its two air bases in Rawalpindi and Punjab province, as part of Operation Sindoor.
item.content:encoded: Pakistan's Deputy Prime Minister Ishaq Dar has said the country was compelled to request a ceasefire with India last month after the latter struck two of its two air bases in Rawalpindi and Punjab province, as part of Operation Sindoor.

item.title: Degrowth And Fashion: Upcycling Innovators Show How To Rethink And Reuse Waste

media:content.media:description: Degrowth is planned reduction of production & consumption to ensure equitable living. (Representative)

item.description: Every year, some 100billion garments are produced worldwide, and 92million tonnes of clothing waste end up in landfills.
item.content:encoded: Every year, some 100billion garments are produced worldwide, and 92million tonnes of clothing waste end up in landfills.

item.title: This Technique Helps You Retain Information In Long-Term Memory

media:content.media:description: It's crucial to apply principles of long-term learning in a useful and personalised way. (Representative)

item.description: The proverb "practice makes perfect" highlights the importance of repetition to master a skill. This principle also applies to learning vocabulary and other material.
item.content:encoded: The proverb "practice makes perfect" highlights the importance of repetition to master a skill. This principle also applies to learning vocabulary and other material.

item.title: 5 Indie Art Spaces In African Cities Worth Knowing More About

media:content.media:description: These spaces favour art in public space, which provides an intriguing lens on the city. (Representaional)

item.description: Independent art spaces are collectives of artists (and others) who club together to set up a communal space often in former industrial sites and more affordable parts of the city to further their practice.
item.content:encoded: Independent art spaces are collectives of artists (and others) who club together to set up a communal space often in former industrial sites and more affordable parts of the city to further their practice.

item.title: What Putin Said When Asked If He's Concerned World Heading Towards World War Three

media:content.media:description: Putin mentioned Russia's own war in Ukraine and the conflict between Israel and Iran. (FILE)

item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Friday that he was worried when asked if he was concerned that the world was heading towards World War Three.
item.content:encoded: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Friday that he was worried when asked if he was concerned that the world was heading towards World War Three.

item.title: Is Mars Really Red? A Physicist Explains The Planet's Reddish Hue

media:content.media:description: The reddish color of Mars comes from iron oxide in the rocks and dust covering its surface.

item.description: People from cultures across the world have been looking at Mars since ancient times. Because it appears reddish, it has often been called the red planet.
item.content:encoded: People from cultures across the world have been looking at Mars since ancient times. Because it appears reddish, it has often been called the red planet.

item.title: Blinding Lights: The Hidden Science Behind Gambling's Glow

media:content.media:description: The colour of the lights surrounding us can shape our behaviour.

item.description: Theres a reason casinos rarely have windows or clocks, theyre engineered to make you lose track of time. But what if its not just time youre losing?
item.content:encoded: Theres a reason casinos rarely have windows or clocks, theyre engineered to make you lose track of time. But what if its not just time youre losing?

item.title: Putin Says "The Whole Of Ukraine Is Ours" In Theory, May Take City Of Sumy

media:content.media:description: "Where the foot of a Russian soldier steps, that is ours." said Mr Putin.

item.description: President Vladimir Putin said on Friday that Russians and Ukrainians were one people, "and in that sense the whole of Ukraine is ours," and said he did not rule out Russia taking control of the Ukrainian city of Sumy.
item.content:encoded: President Vladimir Putin said on Friday that Russians and Ukrainians were one people, "and in that sense the whole of Ukraine is ours," and said he did not rule out Russia taking control of the Ukrainian city of Sumy.

item.title: UAE Man Who Never Worked A Day Wins Rs 26 Lakh In Salary Dispute

media:content.media:description: The ca.se highlights the legal obligation to honour employment contracts

item.description: An employee in Abu Dhabi has won a lawsuit and been awarded approximately Rs 26 lakh in unpaid wages from a company that offered him a job but never allowed him to start working.
item.content:encoded: An employee in Abu Dhabi has won a lawsuit and been awarded approximately Rs 26 lakh in unpaid wages from a company that offered him a job but never allowed him to start working.

item.title: Israeli Scientists Scramble To Save Work After Iranian Missile Hits Labs

media:content.media:description: A building at the campus of the Weizmann Institute of Science was damaged after an Iranian strike

item.description: Researchers at Israel's prestigious Weizmann Institute of Science have been scrambling to save their experiments after an Iranian missile destroyed a building containing dozens of cutting-edge laboratories.
item.content:encoded: Researchers at Israel's prestigious Weizmann Institute of Science have been scrambling to save their experiments after an Iranian missile destroyed a building containing dozens of cutting-edge laboratories.

item.title: Kim Jong Un Sends 6,000 More To Kursk After Massive Troop Losses In Russia

media:content.media:description: Shoigu said Kim is now sending 1,000 sappers and 5,000 workers to rebuild the oblast.

item.description: North Korea is sending 6,000 military personnel to assist in rebuilding Russia's Kursk region, following a visit by a top Russian security official to Pyongyang.
item.content:encoded: North Korea is sending 6,000 military personnel to assist in rebuilding Russia's Kursk region, following a visit by a top Russian security official to Pyongyang.

item.title: "When I Do Tadasana...": When Netanyahu Used Yoga To Link Indian And Israeli Democracy

media:content.media:description: PM Modi visited Israel in 2017.

item.description: The world will celebrate International Yoga Day tomorrow, with events planned across India and 190 other countries. More than 2,000 events will be hosted at 1,300 locations, covering multiple cities.
item.content:encoded: The world will celebrate International Yoga Day tomorrow, with events planned across India and 190 other countries. More than 2,000 events will be hosted at 1,300 locations, covering multiple cities.
